questions.question: Push the button ……………………. you want the elevator.
The prostrate slaves didn’t get up ………………………… the king left.
questions.description: Until refers to time. Up to refers to distance or extent.

questions.question: He was a proud man ………………………. resisted his friends’ offers of help.
questions.description: The relative pronoun who refers to people. It acts as the subject of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: His rapacious ways made him wealthy ……………………….. friendless.
questions.description: But is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He rarely studied, ………………………. he passed every exam.
questions.description: Yet is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: The witness related ……………………….. he had seen.
It stormed ……………………. hard that all the electricity went out.
He is so tight-lipped that no one knew ………………………. he enjoyed the party or not.
The best tactic is to confess ………………………. ask her forgiveness.
The child is unruly ……………………….. he has been spoiled.
The two men look alike ……………………….. are unrelated.
questions.description: But is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She didn’t understand ……………………. was happening to her.
